snippet: Barbara Byrd-Bennett was charged Thursday in a 23-count indictment that detailed a scheme in which she would accept hundreds of thousands of dollars, and more, in exchange for steering contracts to her former employer.
abstract: Federal prosecutors announce Barbara Byrd-Bennett, former head of Chicago Public Schools, will plead guilty to accepting bribes in exchange for awarding $23 million in contracts to her former employers Gary Solomon and Thomas Vranas.
lead_paragraph: Barbara Byrd-Bennett was charged Thursday in a 23-count indictment that detailed a scheme in which she would accept hundreds of thousands of dollars, and more, in exchange for steering contracts to her former employer.

headline.main: Ex-Chicago Schools Head to Plead Guilty to Fraud
headline.print_headline: Ex-Chicago Schools Head to Plead Guilty to Fraud
